name: Avoid using User-Agent based IE detection (Javascript)
description: This rule will check the use of checks (MSIE, Trident, old Edge) in your javascript code.
output:
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code
rationale: UA sniffing is brittle and discouraged; IE-specific checks (MSIE, Trident, old Edge) are legacy.
reference:
– MDN – Browser detection using the user agent: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Browser_detection_using_the_user_agent
– MDN – navigator.userAgent: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/userAgent
remediation: Use feature detection (e.g., checking if a method exists) or standards-based behavior; avoid IE-only branches.
alternativeName: Avoid using User-Agent based IE detection (Javascript)
